title: PV Diagram - compare change in internal energy

content.question:
This diagram shows the thermodynamic cycle <math alttext="1 arrow 2, arrow 3, arrow 4, arrow 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>→</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>→</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>→</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. The dashed lines are isotherms. Each process in the cycle is described as follows.

State <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> to State <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> - Isothermal expansion of the gas

State <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> to State <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> - Isovolumetric cooling of the gas

State <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> to State <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> - Isothermal compression of the gas

State <math alttext="4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn></math> to State <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> - Isovolumetric heating of the gas
Which two processes in the cycle correspond to the same absolute value of the change in internal energy of the gas, <math alttext="the absolute value of delta U" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>|</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>U</mi><mo>|</mo></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>
<math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> and <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math>
<math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>
<math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and <math alttext="D" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math>
